website_summaries.verdict: A solid pair of road bike clipless pedals to choose for the most aerodynamic profile.
pros: Pointed shape of the road bike pedal allows air to flow more easily around the foot
Larger cleats keep the feet in the correct position through the pedaling motion
cons: Larger cleats make it difficult to walk in cycling shoes when off the bike

customer_reviews.title: beginners pedals
customer_reviews.text: These are my first set of clipless pedals since I don't have previous pedals to compare to I feel these pretty solid. I got the white ones, and like another reviewer mentioned they do get pretty dirty pretty easy. What do you expect though?! THEY ARE WHITE! With that said, the scuffs wipe off real easy with ordinary Clorox wipes, and just like that, you have white pedals again. Would I get these again? If I need new pedals, and I don't want to spend a lot? Yes. Will I replace these pedals with the same ones? No, I'll upgrade to Ultegra or Dura Ace.
customer_reviews.author: vwjmkv

customer_reviews.title: Positive lock-in each time
customer_reviews.text: Love these pedals. My "old" Shimano pedals would spin if I missed them when trying to lock in, so I had to look down to ensure I didn't miss. That's was not good at a busy intersection, because I couldn't look away from traffic to see if I was hitting the pedal in the right spot. These pedals stay in the same spot as when you unclipped. Now, no worries. I don't have to look down to know I'm going to "click in" when powering away from a traffic light.
customer_reviews.author: Road Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals amd super sharp looking
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a local store brand with these after getting new cleats that would not clip out, even after multiple adjustments. These were perfectly adjusted right out of box. I did not have to tweak at all - perfect tightness to keep me safely in while allowing a clip out that took just enough effort to feel safe but not trapped. I able to generate a lot of power with these and you can't go wrong with Shimano products. My bike is white with red/black trim and I have received several comments on how sharp the white version looks on my bike. Love these!!!
customer_reviews.author: 49erinnc

customer_reviews.title: You'll never go back.
customer_reviews.text: A great addiction to my cycling gear, although i wiuld offer one piece of advice. DON'T GET WHITE!! It looks great for the firsr werk but after a few hundred miles they look like crap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth while investment
customer_reviews.text: These are great and they fixed a problem I was having with my road bike. For a while I could not figure out where a clicking sound was coming from. First thought it was my shoes and was dreading that it was in the crank but it turned out to be worn out pedals. It was amazing how much difference it makes when you get rid of the slop in the old pedals. Feels like a new bike.
customer_reviews.author: LL on the Prairie

customer_reviews.title: Clunkier than the 105's, but still decent pedals
customer_reviews.text: In comparison to other SPD-SL pedals, these pedals 'feel' heavy when you are clipping in. I am not someone that obsesses over every gram of weight on my bike, but these clips seem to feel significantly heavier/clunkier than the 105's and up. If you want to spend the money on them, I recommend the 105's over these. The 105's (or nicer) seem to feel lighter when clipping in. But if you are on a budget, and like the SPD-SL pedal features (including the few degrees of float, which is nice) then these are still good pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Orange Crush

customer_reviews.title: Cleats. Pedals. Yeah.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, it's one of the less expensive options for clipless pedals. On my first long ride I managed to lose a screw, the others loosened, and I had to lay down next to the bike and pry my foot and cleat out of the pedal. My fault though - now I crank those screws really tight. Walking in gravel really kills the edge of the plastic cleat, but it still works okay. So tips: 1) don't walk in gravel without cleat covers 2) crank those screws and check them frequently
customer_reviews.author: Charles Miske

customer_reviews.title: Working for me!
customer_reviews.text: Being new to clip shoes and pedals, I went ahead and bought these blind to match the shoes that I got locally to ensure proper fit. These were almost half the price of the local store! I'm all for supporting local businesses, but I also have a budget and can't spend wildly on recreational purchases. The pedals: The went on easily, and they clip easily enough. The white is great with my white and red bike and shoes. I get compliments on how good I look all the time (even though I'm slow as s***) so yes, they are the pedals to get!

customer_reviews.title: Great starter clipless pedals
customer_reviews.text: I picked out these pedals because they're a great price for someone who's never tired clipless pedals before. I've had them for a while now and they're great. You can adjust the tension so it's easier or harder to clip out. I'm sure I'll keep them on the easy end for quite a while, but they're great for a beginner!

customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my 10 year old look style pedals. These pedals are nicely priced and they use the common Look style clips.
